title: Kumargram (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Kumargarm (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Alipurduar%20district">Alipurduar district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>. The seat is reserved for <a href="Scheduled%20castes%20and%20scheduled%20tribes">scheduled tribes</a>.
Overview.
As per orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, No. 10 Kumargram (ST) covers <a href="Kumargram%20%28Community%20development%20block%29">Kumargram</a> <a href="Community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a> and Bhatibari, Kohinoor, Mahakalguri Parokata, Samuktala, Tatpara I and Turturi <a href="gram%20panchayat">gram panchayat</a>s in <a href="Alipurduar%20II%20%28Community%20development%20block%29">Alipurduar II</a> community development block.
Kumargram (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is part of No. 2 <a href="Alipurduars%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Alipurduars (Lok Sabha constituency)</a> (ST).
Election results.
2021.
In the <a href="2021%20West%20Bengal%20Legislative%20Assembly%20election">2021 West Bengal Legislative Assembly election</a>, Manoj Kumar Oraon of BJP defeated his nearest rival Leos Kujur of TMC.
2016.
In the <a href="2016%20West%20Bengal%20Legislative%20Assembly%20election">2016 West Bengal Legislative Assembly election</a>, James Kujur of TMC defeated his nearest rival Manoj Kumar Oraon of RSP.
 
2014 Bye election.
In the bye-elections held in 2014, Manoj Kumar Oraon of <a href="Revolutionary%20Socialist%20Party%20%28India%29">RSP</a> defeated <a href="Joachim%20Baxla">Joachim Baxla</a> of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">AITC</a> by 2,667 votes.
2011.
In the <a href="2011%20West%20Bengal%20Legislative%20Assembly%20election">2011 West Bengal Legislative Assembly election</a>, Dasrath Tirkey of RSP defeated his nearest rival Joachim Baxla of Trinamool Congress.
1977-2006.
Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. In the <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006</a> and <a href="2001%20West%20Bengal%20Legislative%20Assembly%20election">2001</a> state assembly elections, Dasrath Tirkey of <a href="Revolutionary%20Socialist%20Party%20%28India%29">RSP</a> defeated Swapan Kujur and Paresh Chandra Das respectively, both <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a>. Salib Toppo of RSP defeated Krishna Chik Baraik of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> in 1996 and Dudsai Topp of Congress in 1991. <a href="Subodh%20Oraon">Subodh Oraon</a> of RSP defeated Khagendra Nath Thakur of Congress in 1987. Subodh Oraon of RSP defeated Dutsai Toppo of Congress in 1982. John Arther Baxla of RSP defeated Konda Bhagat of Congress in 1977.
1967-1972.
Debabrata Chatterjee of Congress won in 1972. Pijush Kanti Mukherjee of Congress won in 1971, 1969 and 1967. Prior to that the Kumargram seat was not there. In <a href="1962%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1962</a> and <a href="1957%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1957</a>, Pijush Kanti Mukherjee of Congress won from the <a href="Alipurduars%20%28Vidhan%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Alipurduars (Vidhan Sabha constituency)</a>. In <a href="1952%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">independent India's first election in 1951</a>, Alipurduars was a joint seat. Pijush Kanti Mukherjee and Dhirandra Nath Brahma Mandal won from there.
